Content: the three differences which distinguish artistic imitation,—the medium, the objects, and the manner.

For the medium being the same, and the objects the same, the poet may imitate by narration—in which case he can either take another personality as Homer does, or speak in his own person, unchanged—or he may present all his characters as living and moving before us.
Comedy aims at representing men as worse, Tragedy as better than in actual life.
we must represent men either as better than in real life, or as worse, or as they are.
medium, the objects, the manner or mode of imitation, being in each case distinct.
